description:
To celebrate the historic southern part of Soho, designated Chinatown 40 years ago, celebrate the art and culture that Chinese Heritage Communities have brought and shared with Londoners.  

The Soho Open House Neighbourhood Festival will be officially opened my the Lord Mayor of Westminster at 1pm.  

Here you will also find information, directions and maps to explore the neighbourhood.

events.name: Drop in: Mind and Body Festival
events.notes:
Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows
                    the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email
                    about any changes to the programme that might affect your
                    visit.

factsheet.heading: Programme
paragraphs:
12:00	Opening: San Yue San dancers (5 mins)
12:05	Programme opening by the Lord Mayor of Westminster
12:15	Taichi by Jenny Chan (talk and demo 15 mins) + audience interaction (30 mins)

13:05	San Yue San dancers + audience interaction (10 mins)
13:15	Qigong and Taichi by Chew-Yeen Lawes (45 mins demo + audience interaction)

14:05	San Yue San dancers + audience interaction (10 mins)
14:15	Taichi Kungfu Fan by Simon Wong (15 mins) + audience interaction (30 mins)

factsheet.heading: Chinese Heritage Alliance
paragraphs: The Chinese Heritage alliance CHA is a partnership of Chinese heritage organisations and individuals currently consisting of independent artists. the Chinese Community Centre, Chinese Information & Advice Centre, Chinatown Collective and The Meridian Society.
The event is held in partnership with Open House London and Westminster City Council and with the support of Westminster Connects.

travel_info: Tube: Leicester Square, Oxford Circus, Tottenham Court Road

name: Soho Square Gardens
